Package com.openclassroom.safetynet.controller

Class MedicalRecordController

java.lang.Object
com.openclassroom.safetynet.controller.MedicalRecordController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/medicalrecord") public class MedicalRecordController extends Object
REST Controller for managing medical records data. This controller provides endpoints for creating, updating, and deleting medical records.

  • Method Details

    • createMedicalRecord

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse> createMedicalRecord(@Validated @RequestBody MedicalRecordDTO medicalRecordDTO) throws URISyntaxException
      Creates a new medical record. This method processes the incoming POST request to add a new medical record to the system. It validates the provided MedicalRecordDTO and calls the service layer to persist the medical record. Upon successful creation, it returns a response with a 201 status and the location of the new resource.
      Parameters:
      medicalRecordDTO - The MedicalRecordDTO containing the details of the medical record to be created.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a status of 201 (Created) and the URI of the newly created medical record.
      Throws:
      URISyntaxException - If the URI for the created resource cannot be constructed.

    • updateMedicalRecord

      @PutMapping("/{firstName}/{lastName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse> updateMedicalRecord(@PathVariable @Validated @NotBlank @NotBlank String firstName, @PathVariable @Validated @NotBlank @NotBlank String lastName, @Validated @RequestBody MedicalRecordDTO medicalRecordDTO)
      Updates an existing medical record. This method processes the incoming PUT request to update an existing medical record based on the provided firstName and lastName. It validates the provided MedicalRecordDTO and calls the service layer to update the medical record details. Upon successful update, it returns a response with a 200 status indicating the medical record was updated successfully.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The firstName of the person medical record to update.
      lastName - The lastName of the person medical record to update.
      medicalRecordDTO - The MedicalRecordDTO containing the new medical record details.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a status of 200 (OK) indicating the medical record was updated.

    • deleteMedicalRecord

      @DeleteMapping("/{firstName}/{lastName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteMedicalRecord(@PathVariable @Validated @NotBlank @NotBlank String firstName, @PathVariable @Validated @NotBlank @NotBlank String lastName)
      Deletes an existing medical record. This method processes the incoming DELETE request to remove a medical record from the system based on the provided firstName and lastName. It calls the service layer to delete the medical record and returns a response indicating whether the deletion was successful.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The firstName of the person medical record to delete.
      lastName - The lastName of the person medical record to delete.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with either a 204 (No Content) status if the deletion was successful, or a 404 (Not Found) status if the medical record was not found.
